Source.Text:
Statement 1: As an abolitionist, JMW Turner used Romantic painting techniques to incite his viewers’ outrage against slavery.

Statement 2: As a Spaniard, Goya was horrified by the brutality of the occupying French troops and wanted to record the sacrifice of his countrymen.

Statement 3: Since John Constable felt such a strong connection to the countryside of his youth, his paintings have to be considered romanticized versions of the actual locations he depicted.

Statement 4: As commercial artists, Constable, Turner and Goya were primarily motivated by financial gain and painted pictures they thought the public would want to buy.

Statement 5: The architects who designed the new Parliament buildings showed that they were Romantic architects by emphasizing Britain’s links to its medieval past in their designs.

question.qText: All of the following are true about Romanticism EXCEPT

aBtn.aText: that romanticism was a Europe-wide artistic movement
that romanticism emphasized themes such as the power of nature, nationalism, and a longing for the past
that mathematical perspective and classical anatomy and precise brushwork were important to all Romantic artists
that the style and subject matter of Romantic at varied from country to country
that romantic painters were free to paint the subjects and in the style they wanted

question.qText: Romantic artists were interested in depicting all the following EXCEPT
Romanticism in art appealed to all of the following EXCEPT
Read the statements in the VIEW box. All of the following are valid point of view statements EXCEPT
